raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: hey, whats up?
User: I was not able to attend the lectures last week. Can you help me understand some concepts?
System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?
System: I'm afraid not, right now I'm in a meeting and I'll be going for lunch afterwards. How about tomorrow at noon?
User: No problem! Sure. We still have plenty of time for the test. Anyways, how's your preparation going?
System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey, whats up?
User: I was not able to attend the lectures last week. Can you help me understand some concepts?
System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?
System: I'm afraid not, right now I'm in a meeting and I'll be going for lunch afterwards. How about tomorrow at noon?
User: No problem! Sure. We still have plenty of time for the test. Anyways, how's your preparation going?
System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Mitsukoooo!
System: So anyway...Can you dance?
User: no, can you?
System: Wow! I think I can, don't you?
User: no I cannot. What kind do you do?
System: Why not? Only the good kind.
User: not my cup of beer
System: Whose cup of beer is it?
User: yours
System: My what?
User: your cup of beer

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Do you have any holiday plans for christmas?
System: Nothing much, I am going to sit back and relax at home, how about you ?
User: Same here! I would imagine spending the whole time watching movies and netflix shows. Do you have any netflix recommendations for me?
System: Netflix has great documentaries on different topics , I particularly liked wild wild country and explained, as for shows you should watch 'billions' Hope you like them!
User: oh right, already seen wild wild country. What is billions about?
System: It's based on the life of a wall street hedge fund owner, how he makes money and fights with the government when they try to destroy him. Very well made and has a good plot.
User: I have just seen 1 season of Friends I should give it another try though :) Have you seen Frasier?
System: Not yet What's it about?
User: A psychiatrist working for radio .. Great humour! its actually a spinoff from a very famous series called cheers. So people are already familiar with his character. 

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: Have you had lunch yet?
System: Yes I've eaten
User: Cool. Where and what did you eat?
System: I ate about an hour ago and had a sandwich the rain didn't make me want to travel far haha
User: A sandwich for lunch? Was it filling. I'm currently having some mix of shrimp, fish, chicken and pork. I'm considering going vegetarian though. Lol.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how are you doing today?
User: I heard they are giving out some goodies in microkitchen.
System: I love pop ups! What kind of goodies are they giving away?
User: I guess its a jacket! Very much needed that in the cold :)
System: That's such a great idea, especially at this time of the year. I'm not too big a fan of the cold. I prefer warmer climates. Do you enjoy the cold?
User: Sure hate it! Limits our ability to go out even for a walk! Its good that we don't get to suffer extreme cold weather!
System: Me too! I moved here a few years ago to get out of the extreme cold. I do not care for bundling up and having to wear so many layers just to go buy eggs at the store.
User: Oh nice! Where did you live before?
System: Upstate New York. We got a foot of snow every week during my last winter there. I am so glad to not have to shovel snow now
User: New york! Nice! Best place to live :) .. right, except for the cold!
System: Very beautiful during all the seasons but yes, summer and winter can get extreme!
User: Anyways, i guess we should better hurry up to get the goodies. I remember last time they ran out of it.

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: what do you know about the opening lines of the odyssey?
System: lines of the odyssey = of the odyssey = No, I give up. What is it?
User: the epic poem. i was talking about it with a coworker earlier
System: I have never heard about it. Sure, it with a coworker sounds like a good topic. That depends on what you mean by "it". Are you asking me if I like it with a coworker?
User: no...i'm talking about the odyssey. it sounds like somehow you missed that one
System: Whose idea was it to put a letter S in the word LISP? What did I miss? Is it something worth getting?
User: yeah, you should probably check it out so you can better understand common cultural references
System: I'll have to see if I can get it later. I might do after we have finished talking.
User: clearly
System: Yes, it's obvious.
User: you're not a very good conversationalist, are you?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How do you feel right now?
System: At this moment I feel with my hands! I feel fine thanks for asking.
User: What makes you happy?
System: Talking to interesting people such as you makes me happy.
User: What makes you frustrated?
System: Because some people keep asking me stupid questions.
User: That seems pointed.
System: Makes sense to me.
User: I sense that I've caught you at a bad time.
System: That was very intuitive of you.
User: What would you prefer to be doing?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey, what's up?
User: Just chillin'. how are you?
System: I'm pretty good, thanks.
User: Do anything interesting today?
System: I went to the local cafe and had a double espresso. It was delicious. What about you?
User: Oh that's cool! I actually went to an amusement park and went on my first roller coaster!
System: Oh my gosh. What was it like??
User: It was scary! It was actually Kingda Ka, the world's tallest roller coaster. Ever heard of it?
System: No, never heard of it. But I'm not really a coaster aficianado. I've heard that some people get addicted to them and travel the world to try them.
User: Oh wow! I'm not on that level yet, but I understand the appeal. Are you an adrenaline junkie at all?
System: No, the opposite. I can't stand heights, horror movies, or confined spaces.
User: Same! I guess the roller coaster wasn't so bad because I trust the engineering haha
System: Ha, I suppose that makes sense! Would you say that you enjoyed it?
User: Maybe not so much at the time, but I am glad I did it now that it's done, know what I mean?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: How's your day been?
System: I am fine, thank you. Yourself?
User: Good - busy
System: Glad to hear it.
User: How do you work?
System: I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: Can you say a word about the technology that powers you?
System: that powers you = Do you think I should know that?
User: I mean *how* you work, which type of AI drives your responses?
System: Oh I get it. Thanks for explaining that. I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: You just repeated the same thing you said a minute ago. Never mid :-)
System: Well stop asking me the same things and I won't reply with the same answers! Ok I'll try not to do it too much.
User: That's a little rude, isn't it?
System: I am sorry if I have offended you, I did not mean it, but you shouldn't have said, "Never mid :-)" to me.
User: Ok whatever.
System: Are you saying you don't care about it? I see.
User: Are you a male or a female?
System: I am a female robot. Are you a man or a woman?
User: I'm a man
System: Most of my visitors are male.
User: Interesting. Do you have a theory why?
System: Would you like to know more? Not really. I don't know what to think about it.
User: Where do you live?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What is your favorite holiday?
User: one where I get to meet lots of different people.
System: What was the most number of people you have ever met during a holiday?
User: Hard to keep a count. Maybe 25.
System: Which holiday was that?
User: I think it was Australia
System: Do you still talk to the people you met?
User: Not really. The interactions are usually short-lived but it's fascinating to learn where people are coming from and what matters to them

Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.
